name: See No Evil
description: See No Evil is a dark, isometric puzzle game about sound manipulation. A harsh fantasy where the willingly blind are hostile to the nonconformist. Sometimes, the world seems darker with your eyes open.
minimum_requirements: OS: Microsoft® Windows® XP / Vista / 7 / 8 Processor: 1.2GHz processor Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 32 mb DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 120 MB available space Additional Notes: Microsoft Xbox 360 Controller or Direct Input compatible controller
recommended_requirements: OS: Microsoft® Windows® XP / Vista / 7 / 8 Processor: 2GHz dual core processor Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 32 mb DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 120 MB available space Additional Notes: Microsoft Xbox 360 Controller or Direct Input compatible controller

reviews.review_text: This game is fantastic. The art is beautiful, the music is great, and the whole idea means something. Which is great for a game. Buy it, play it, love it.

It's a puzzle game and it's NOT revolutionary. You manipulate the world around you by shouting to distract guards, push and pull objects to manipulate your shouts. Steam achievements are an essential addition,   I wouldn't say it lives up to SOME of the reviews I've seen, I'm definately enjoying slowly progressing through the campaign and the puzzles are becoming more and more difficult, as you would expect. Other than that I really can't think of much else to say.. I guess the atmosphere is ok, I'm not getting the full benefit playing on a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ laptop though.  The only controls I've come across so far is UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, SPACE BAR (SHOUT), E (PUSH/PULL) - nice and simple  Not sure if it's worth £10.99 to be brutally honest though - although still early days  If you can get it on offer go for it
I understand the moral of this story which is 'open your eyes'. Although the moral is clear the story is just there really, but I wouldn't recommend this game if it wasn't fun.
